DEFAULT ENGLISH:

DEFAULT ENGLISH:
The module you want to link to in menu.
The module is ignored when specifying a custom URL
TRANSLATION FOREIGN LANGUAGE:
The module you want to link to in menu.
The module is ignored when specifying a custom URL

DEFAULT ENGLISH:
This URL slug points to page in the module you set above.
A URL slug is the last part of a URL.
TRANSLATION FOREIGN LANGUAGE:
This URL slug points to page in the module you set above.
A URL slug is the last part of a URL.

DEFAULT ENGLISH:
Instead of linking to a module, you can link also link to a custom url (starting with http://).
When you submit a URL here, the system completely ignores the "module" and the "module-url-slug" you set above.
In other words: leave this field empty when you want to link to an internal module
TRANSLATION FOREIGN LANGUAGE:
Instead of linking to a module, you can link also link to a custom url (starting with http://).
When you submit a URL here, the system completely ignores the "module" and the "module-url-slug" you set above.
In other words: leave this field empty when you want to link to an internal module

DEFAULT ENGLISH:
Depending on the permissions of the user, the system shows only certain menu items to users who have the proper permissions.
Which permission resource would you like to use to show this menu item?
You can assign/retract permissions to users in the user module under "roles and permissions"
TRANSLATION FOREIGN LANGUAGE:
Depending on the permissions of the user, the system shows only certain menu items to users who have the proper permissions.
Which permission resource would you like to use to show this menu item?
You can assign/retract permissions to users in the user module under "roles and permissions"

DEFAULT ENGLISH:
A cronjob performs maintenance on regular basis (once a day is preferred) to keep this system running fast and smooth.
Things that happen are for example: emptying caches, deleting old users.
It also performs necessary actions that need to happen without user input.
For example: checking for intrusion, sending notification emails, sending invoices to clients etc.

Examples:
TRANSLATION FOREIGN LANGUAGE:
A cronjob performs maintenance on regular basis (once a day is preferred) to keep this system running fast and smooth.
Things that happen are for example: emptying caches, deleting old users.
It also performs necessary actions that need to happen without user input.
For example: checking for intrusion, sending notification emails, sending invoices to clients etc.

Examples:

DEFAULT ENGLISH:
Point the Linux cronjob manager or Windows task scheduler to url:

[url]
TRANSLATION FOREIGN LANGUAGE:
Point the Linux cronjob manager or Windows task scheduler to url:

DEFAULT ENGLISH: Recommendation: Run CronJob ASAP! The last one ran more than 24 hours ago.

DEFAULT ENGLISH:
The installer installs, updates and removes the installation of [applicationname].
To use the installer, it needs to be enabled and you need a password to prevent others from using it.

Disable the installer when you don't use it to prevent malicious actors manipulating and removing data from the system.
TRANSLATION FOREIGN LANGUAGE:
The installer installs, updates and removes the installation of [applicationname].
To use the installer, it needs to be enabled and you need a password to prevent others from using it.

Disable the installer when you don't use it to prevent malicious actors manipulating and removing data from the system.

DEFAULT ENGLISH: Disable the installer for security reasons when you are not actively using it.
TRANSLATION FOREIGN LANGUAGE: Disable the installer for security reasons when you are not actively using it.
